sentences.en: A stodgy pudding served up when everyone was already full.
sentences.cn: 在每个人都吃饱的时候,油腻腻的布丁又端上来了.

sentences.en: After reading these stodgy philosophers, I find his pellucid style very enjoyable.
sentences.cn: 在阅读这些乏味的哲学家, 我觉得他的透明风格非常愉快.

sentences.en: Dark blue is sometimes seen as staid or stodgy - old - fashioned.
sentences.cn: 深蓝色的是有时被视为稳重或油腻 - 老式.

sentences.en: Even the normally stodgy Xinhua News Agency has weighed in.
sentences.cn: 甚至一贯保守的新华社也参与进来.

sentences.en: Gradually it acquired its own editorial voice, and with it a somewhat stodgy image.
sentences.cn: 其后杂志逐步添加入了自己的评论, 尽管其观点令人稍感乏味.

sentences.en: He was disgusted with the stodgy pizzas on sale in London.
sentences.cn: 他讨厌吃伦敦卖的难以下咽的比萨饼。

sentences.en: I want something to read. These volumes are stodgy.
sentences.cn: 我要一些可读的东西, 这些书本本枯燥乏味.

sentences.en: It wasn't easy to lose puppy fat when Mum fed her on stodgy home cooking.
sentences.cn: 母亲给她吃易饱的家常菜,她想减掉婴儿肥可是很难.

sentences.en: She laughed to herself, then looked sideways at this stodgy nurse.
sentences.cn: 她顾自大笑起来, 然后斜眼看了看这个墨守成规的护士.

sentences.en: She poked fun at Alec because he was shy and stodgy.
sentences.cn: 她开亚历克的玩笑,因为他羞怯,同时还有些枯燥沉闷.

sentences.en: The company hasn't been able to shake off its image as stodgy and old-fashioned.
sentences.cn: 该公司一直未能摆脱其古板守旧的形象。

sentences.en: The gateman was a stodgy fellow of 60.
sentences.cn: 看门人是个六十岁的矮胖子.

sentences.en: These were not the old stodgy ads listing goods for sale.
sentences.cn: 这不是那种列明打折商品的旧式、乏味的广告.

sentences.en: They're not cultured or interesting, they are boring stodgy old things.
sentences.cn: 他们没修养，很乏味，是一群无聊古板的老家伙。

sentences.en: U . membership , and in doing so shepherded their makeovers from stodgy Soviet vassals into economic dynamos.
sentences.cn: 通过整合实现了诸国从笨拙的前苏联属国向经济发动机的转变.

trans.tran_cn: <英，贬>（食物）吃下去感觉撑的，易饱的，滞涩的，古板的
trans.tran_en: If someone or something is stodgy, they are dull, unimaginative, and commonplace
